When shutting down the eclipse platform with autorefresh (and native support 
using com.example.autorefresh.win32_2.0.0_20021007) plugins installed, the 
following null pointer exception may happen:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.example.autorefresh.AutoRefreshPlugin.monitorFailed
(AutoRefreshPlugin.java:402)
	at com.example.autorefresh.win32.internal.Win32Monitor.run
(Win32Monitor.java:107)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:536)

The problem seems to be a race condition in AutoRefreshPlugin shutdown: the 
fMonitorManager may be nulled before all monitor threads have terminated.

The problem i.e. does not occur in debug mode.

I've found out that the specific error of the WAIT_FAILED signal which is 
attempted to be reported Win32Monitor.run is 6 (invalid handle). 

Maybe we shoud wait until all monitor threads have been terminated (i.e. using 
Thread.join) before setting fMonitorManager to null.

side note: although both Win32Monitor.removePath and getHandles are both 
synchronized, once run has obtained the handles, they could be used while 
another thread invalidates them. However I don't think this is the cause for 
the problem described.
This has been fixed with my latest work.
